basics.name: Mohamed Moustafa
basics.label: Software Engineer
basics.summary: I'm a full-stack software engineer with 8 years of experience in SaaS-based platforms. I specialize in design systems and web accessibility. I also have experience leading projects and cross-team initiatives. In my free time I play music, read, and work on coding projects.

work.name: GitLab
work.summary: GitLab is a DevOps platform that provides a single application for the entire software development lifecycle.
highlights: Leads project on team of 7 to enable purchasing & provisioning of Duo Enterprise AI offering, driving 5-figure user sign-ups, using Vue.js, Ruby on Rails, GraphQL & PostgreSQL.
Maintainer of Customers Portal, handling merge request reviews & deployments.
Member of accessibility working group, aligning Customers Portal with GitLab standards.

work.name: Livestorm
work.summary: Livestorm is a video platform for creating, organizing & hosting webinars & virtual meetings.
highlights: Collaborated with Infrastructure team to set up new microservice using AWS, Kubernetes & Terraform.
Maintained, refactored & documented public-facing API layers using Ruby on Rails & Swagger.
Implemented new features for application dashboard UI using Vue.js, GraphQL & Apollo.

work.name: Studytube (formerly Springest)
work.summary: Studytube is an online learning platform used by businesses for compliance and upskilling teams.
highlights: Led research of proof-of-concept for containerizing monolithic application into Docker.
Researched refactoring of core "Course Listing" back-end model design.

work.name: Vidyard
work.summary: Vidyard is a video platform used by businesses for creating, sharing, & tracking video content.
highlights: Led UI design system working group, governing future goals & maintainership with 6 team members.
MaintainedUI component library using Vue.js across all frontend services.
Upgraded platform's major components to WCAG AA 2.0 accessibility standards.
Integrated stand-alone microservice into application architecture, using Docker, Kubernetes & OAuth.
